page.title: 18INTERESTING PEOPLE-1
page.content: {Mr Williams }was born in Condover in 1907.He attended Condover Primary School and he left when he was 14.He had a job as a carpenter making coffins and wheelwright.Then he worked for a local carpenter for 47 years.In his early days most road traffic was horse drawn.His father was village shoe maker and postman.The remains of a set of wooden stocks for shoeing horses can still be seen on the grass verge outside the village school now partly hidden by the trees.His hobbies are gardening and fishing.He is 78 now and he's been married for 54 years.He was in the choir for 2o years.During the war he was in the Observer Corps and he was also in the Home Guard.He and his wife are members of the Evergreens_the Local senior citezens club.
